JobFullDesc: Join a movement in which everyone can win. We started a movement in which everyone can win – shoppers, retailers, society, and every person on our team. To play fair, trust people and reward them for doing the right thing. We see and feel the impact of our work as more and more people gain financial freedom and retailers grow across the globe.Clearpay EU is part of the Afterpay Limited Family. Founded five years ago in Sydney, Australia, Afterpay and Clearpay have millions of active customers globally and are offered by the best retailers around the world including Boohoo, ASOS, Marks & Spencer, JD Sports, and many others. Afterpay is on a mission to power an economy in which everyone wins.Afterpay is completely free for customers who pay on time – helping people spend responsibly without incurring interest, fees, or extended debt. Afterpay empowers customers to access the things they want and need, while still allowing them to maintain financial wellness and control, by splitting payments in four, for both online and in-store purchases. Afterpay is deeply committed to delivering positive outcomes for customers. We are focused on supporting our community of shoppers.We trust in the next generation and share a vision of a more accessible and sustainable world in which people are rewarded for doing the right thing.The Opportunity As Clearpay EU’s Senior Accountant, you will be a key contributor to our Financial Control team, your accounting skills will support Clearpay in maintaining the financial systems and processes to ensure that financial information is timely, accurate, complete, and compliant. With relevant accounting requirements and expectations for Clearpay EU, you will report directly to our EU Financial Controller. Unlike a traditional accounting role, you will be exposed to the fast-changing world of Clearpay & Afterpay!We are much more than our job descriptions, but here’s where you will begin…. -You will contribute to the financial control function for EU being a key part of the month-end close and year-end close and ensure timely and accurate reporting, including preparation of balance sheet reconciliations and analysis of variances, according to globally established timelines -Prepare month-end accruals and other expense-related journals for the month and quarter-end. Partner with Finance and Accounting department in relation to the month-end process -Work with the EU Financial Controller, prepare the full suite of monthly financial statements for Clearpay EU, reporting on all material variances. Liaise with the Group Financial Control team on consolidation of the results into the Group results. Preparation of ad-hoc reports and analysis as required -Work with the EU Financial Controller to ensure statutory reporting obligations are managed, embedding best practice external reporting. This includes liaising with external auditors -Partner with the Accounts Payable and Merchant settlements teams to maintain best-practice policies, processes, and internal controls to ensure the highest standards of financial integrity are attained as well as alignment with global ways of working -Partner with the broader finance team to implement best practice policies, processes and internal controls to ensure the highest standards of financial integrity are attained as well as alignment with global ways of working -Create and initiate new initiatives and procedures to support expanding team deliverables driven by business growth -Ad hoc finance projects, including external audit requests, expense reporting, payroll, VAT, and tax mattersWho are you? Like us, you’ll be deeply committed to delivering positive outcomes for customers and passionate about shaping the future of Afterpay. -Financial accountant in a company with global operations or in reputable accounting practice. Background in Chartered environment highly valued. -Excellent working knowledge of IFRS. -Tertiary qualifications in Finance or Accounting, and membership of one of the accounting associations (ACCA, ACA, CIMA) or substantial relevant work experience. -Experience in managing the month-end process, including complex balance sheet reconciliations. -Experience in working with and liaising with external auditors for the year-end reporting. -Comfortable with change and working in a growing and fast-paced environment. -Hunger to learn, apply skills, and grow within the organization. -Ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize deliverables. -Experienced in MS Excel. -Excellent systems skills, ideally ERP systems (Microsoft Dynamics).    -Fluent in English. Proficiency in other EU languages is highly desirable, especially French and/or German.You like to keep it real with your actions, be brave with your decisions, do the right thing for all our stakeholders, and shape the future with excitement.How we reward youWe have a pay-for-performance culture so you can expect to be rewarded for high performance. We pride ourselves on fairness and offer a competitive total reward package made up of salary, incentives, and benefits.  We have a strong focus on health and wellbeing at Afterpay as we aim to support you to succeed in both your career and personal lives, such as providing employees with: - A corporate membership to Headspace- Private Health Insurance- Competitive economical package (flexible compensation plan)- Career Development Opportunities (constantly learning new technologies, and professionally grow)- Training Program- Extended Annual Holiday Leave- Flexible Working Hours (half-day on Fridays)- Gym membership- Fresh organic fruit, Coffee & Tea- Team Building Activities- Employee Referral System- Language lessons- Friendly and supportive team- Great working environment We value diversity and a collaborative and inclusive environment where everyone feels they belong is important to us.How to Apply: We don’t know what the future holds. That’s the exciting part; we show up and make it happen. If you’re brave, if you’re committed to doing the right thing, and excited by this opportunity, click apply now!Afterpay is continuing to hire for all open roles with all interviewing and on-boarding done virtually due to COVID-19. All new team members, in addition to current staff, will temporarily work from home until it is safe to return to our offices
